title: Open Knowledge Extraction Challenge

author: Michael Röder, Agile Knowledge Engineering and Semantic Web (AKSW), University of Leipzig

segmentation: OK, it's me again.
And this time I would like to present the open Knowledge extraction challenge.
I'm here again, is a list of the people who organized the challenge, and there's also of course.
The challenge description on the Project Hobbit on The Hobbit Project webpage.

And this challenge is about knowledge extraction, and it comprises four tasks, focus named entity identification and linking, then a broader named entity identification at linking a focused musical named entity recognition and linking and a knowledge extraction task.

This is the third iteration of the Okayyy challenge at the SWC, and this is the first time that we are carrying it out using The Hobbit benchmarking platform, but it is as a years ago we are using the NLP interchange format for to communicate with the participating systems.
The first task is.
Yeah, the focused named entity identification and linking the goal is for the system.
It receives a text and it has to identify and link named entities.
To reference knowledge base which is in this case DB pedia and the named entities need to have the.

Identified named entities.

Manually created data set and the benchmark is.

More gentle to the system that means the system receives the document, then it has some time to answer this and after that time or after the benchmark receive the answer of the system, it receives the next document.
And this scenario also can contain emerging entities.
That means that not all entities.
That have to be identified are also in the knowledge base.
KP eyes for this in our precision recall and on the F measure a scenario B is a little bit different.
It is more like a stress test and it is based on a synthetic synthetically generated datasets.
That means that the system receives documents and over the time it receives the amount of documents that it receives per second increases.
And what we want to know here is whether the system's performance decreases with an increasing amount of requests.
So Additionally to precision recall and F Metro we have this F1 score points per second.
The second task is like an extension of the first task, so here the goal is to identify more types of named entities.
We have these twelve types.

On the third task, we are using a different reference knowledge base.

There we are using Musicbrainz and the system should identify and type the entities for scenario A and scenario be it has to link them to Musicbrainz and we have the kepis precision, recall and F measure.
As the 4th task was planned as knowledge extraction.
